domino_project

Class MultiplayerGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • domino_project.MultiplayerGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CardinalGame, HungarianGame

    public abstract class MultiplayerGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents a Multiplayer DominoGame.Multiplayer means Player(user) + Bots(1 or more).For example, Cardinal and Hungarian belong to MultiplayerGame(Solo1 does NOT).It consists of players(ArrayList),board(MultiplayerBoard and a MultiplayerGui for GUI.MultiplayerGame implements runnable(Thread).

    • Field Summary

      protected MultiplayerBoard board
      The board of the MultiplayerGame.
      protected MultiplayerGui gui
      MultiplayerGui for Graphical User Interface.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Player> players
      ArrayList of Player consisting all the players of the MultiplayerGame.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiplayerGame

        public MultiplayerGame(int num)
        Class Constructor. Fills the ArrayList of Player(first human and then the Bot(s))and initializes the rest variables.
        Parameters:
        num - number of players playing this game(user+Bots)

    • Method Detail

      • order

        protected void order()
        Determines the order of player playing this game according to the Highest Double Tile of their hand and cycling order. For example if we have 2 Bots and Bot 1 has the Highest Double Tile the order of playing is like this: Bot 1,Bot 2,Human(previously: Human,Bot 1,Bot 2).

      • fillObjects

        protected void fillObjects(int amount)
        The board is filled and players get their hand.
        Parameters:
        amount - integer representing the amount of tiles that player have at thei hand.

      • isPlayerAbleToPlay

        protected boolean isPlayerAbleToPlay(Player p)
        Checks if Player p is able to put a tile on Line. If they have no tiles on hand returns false.
        Parameters:
        p - player to be checked
        Returns:
        true if p is able to put a tile on Line, otherwise false.

      • getPosOfTileByPlayer
